title: Scan surrounding nodes
content: From the starting node, we take all of the surrounding nodes. This is the first step in creating a tree from the graph. This first set of surrounding nodes is called the frontier

title: Check surround nodes
content: Once we have scanned all of the nodes we then check each individual one to see if it's the final (goal) node

title: Restart from bottom layer
content: From each of the frontier nodes we then scan the surround nodes. This creates another layer in this tree that we're creating

title: Choose a starting station
content:
To find a route, start by clicking a station to navigate from.
Alternatively change any of the options at the top to vary the search type.

title: Choose a destination station
content: Now pick a station to find a path to, starting from %s then click Next to begin

title: Now start searching
content: A route will now be found between %s and %s. Click next to start the search algorithm or change the search type, now is your last chance!
